name: immodesty
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of having too high an opinion of yourself: His honesty is sometimes interpreted as immodesty. He dubbed his Community Church, with characteristic immodesty, the White House.
the act of showing too much of the body: He thought the advertisement showed immodesty and an overabundant display of flesh. They protested against immodesty of dress. See
immodest
More examplesFewer examplesThey display the optimism and immodesty which seems to characterize many Silicon Valley firms. She talks with self-confidence and irrepressible immodesty. Some of the actors were cast more for their immodesty than their singing voices.
